title: Mobile Phone Utilization Strategies in University Classes: Intentional/Improvisational Teaching-Based Microlearning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Ability to use basic smartphone functions, foundational language learning skills (grammar/vocabulary)
context.additional_context: Emphasis on behavioral guidelines and motivational strategies for language learning via smartphones in resource-constrained technological environments.

learning_goals: Learners can perform real-time language feedback (voice/text) at least three times using a mobile app.
Design two or more learning activities by distinguishing intentional teaching methods (flashcard creation) from spontaneous teaching methods (situational dialogue recording).
When using mobile devices, apply behavioral rules with at least 80% compliance (participation rate/concentration level) based on peer evaluation criteria.

resources: Smartphone Basic Applications (Voice Recorder, Camera, Notes)
Free Language Learning Apps (Anki, Duolingo, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
